cetus.hir

Class RangeExpression

  • java.lang.Object
    • cetus.hir.Expression
      • cetus.hir.RangeExpression
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Printable, Traversable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<Expression>

    public class RangeExpression
extends Expression
    RangeExpression represents a symbolic range with a lower bound expression and an upper bound expression. RangeAnalysis uses RangeExpression to compute a valid value ranges of variables at program points.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class cetus.hir.Expression

        ub - the upper bound expression.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if lb or ub is invalid.
        NotAnOrphanException - if lb or ub has a parent.

        Parameters:

        ub - the upper bound expression.
        stride - the stride expression
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if lb or ub is invalid.
        NotAnOrphanException - if lb or ub has a parent.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the range expression. The returned string is equivalent to the printed stream through defaultPrint(cetus.hir.RangeExpression, java.io.PrintWriter).
        Overrides:
        toString in class Expression
        Returns:
        the string representation.

      • hashCode

        protected int hashCode(int h)
        Description copied from class: Expression
        Returns cumulative hash code with the given initial value, h. This is intended for optimizing memory usage when computing hash code of an expression object. Previous approach constructs a string representation of the expression to get the hash code while this approach uses the same algorithm as String.hashCode() without creating a string. All sub classes of Expression have there specific implementations of this method and Expression.hashCode() simply returns hashCode(0).
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class Expression

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Expression e)
        Compares the range expression with the specified expression for order.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Expression>
        Overrides:
        compareTo in class Expression
        Returns:
        0 if they are equal, -1 otherwise.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Checks if this range expression has a lower bound greater than the upper bound. The comparison is possible only for literals and infinity expression.

      • isOmega

        public boolean isOmega()
        Checks if this range expression does not have any closed bounds.

      • isBounded

        public boolean isBounded()
        Returns true if neither lb nor ub is infinity.

      • toRange

        public static RangeExpression toRange(Expression e)
        Converts an arbitrary expression to a range expression by setting the same lower bound and upper bound.

      • toExpression

        public Expression toExpression()
        Converts this range expression to a non-range expression if the lower bound is equal to the upper bound.

      • getOmega

        public static Expression getOmega()
        Returns a new instanceof omega expression which is [-inf:inf].
        Returns:
        a new omega expression.

      • getSize

        public Expression getSize()
        Returns the size of the span bounded by this range expression.
        Returns:
        the resulting expression or null if not bounded.
